channel.title: Posts on Jordan Hart
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Jordan Hart

item.title: How Accurate are Inferred Social Networks?
item.description: In behavioural ecology, animal social networks are used to answer a wide variety of questions.

item.title: The Problem with Permutations
item.description: This is a short blog post to complement our paper on non-independence and permutation tests in animal social network analysis.

item.title: Tiny Steps, Big Problems
item.description: Statistical tests based on permutations (also called randomisations or resampling) are popular in many fields.

item.title: Building Social Networks with BISoN
item.description: Social networks have become an important tool in behavioural ecology.

item.title: A better environment manager for Python?
item.description: Over the last year I’ve started using the Poetry tool for managing Python virtual environments and project dependencies.

item.title: Jax, Flax, & Macs
item.description: JAX is a powerful tensor manipulation and autograd library that has seen a surge in popularity recently.
